title: Ground News - Live video from the scene as Staten Island to host St. Patrick’s Parade that will allow LGBTQ+ persons to march openly
text: Live video from the scene as Staten Island to host St. Patrick’s Parade that will allow LGBTQ+ persons to march openly Staten Island is home to the last remaining St. Patrick's Day Summary by Ground News [parade](https://ground.news/interest/parade)in New York City that excludes LGBTQ+ groups for the first time. The new parade will take place on March 17, said Mayor Eric Adams' spokesperson Kayla Mamelak, and will be separate from the standing parade on Staten Island. 2 Articles 2 Articles All Left Center Right [] Staten Island Advance Live video from the scene as Staten Island to host St. Patrick’s Parade that will allow LGBTQ+ persons to march openly STATEN ISLAND, N.Y. – A new St. Patrick’s Parade to be held on Staten Island next month will allow gays to march openly. 4 hours ago·Richmond County, United StatesRead Full Article Think freely.Subscribe and get full access to Ground NewsSubscriptions start at $9.99/year [Subscribe](/subscribe) Not enough coverage to generate an Article Assistant.
